articles.title: Everything you need to know when travelling between India and Europe after new strain of COVID-19 prompts... - Moneycontrol.com
articles.description: If travellers have not been to any of the countries under India's 'at risk' category they will be allowed to leave the airport and shall self-monitor their health for 14 days post-arrival.
articles.content:
As India prepares to resume commercial flights on December 15, a new strain of the COVID-19 virus called Omicron has once again instilled fear in countries across the world.
